Job Posting: 177202 - Position: S26 Data & Analytics Engineer Co-op/Internship (Summer and/or Fall 2026) 177202 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/22/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/15/2026 04:18 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI) 750 Pandora Ave Victoria V8W 0E4 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Data & Analytics Engineer Co-op/Internship (Summer and/or Fall 2026) 177202 Co-op Position Victoria, BC Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $2,155.00 gross bi-weekly Use your analytical, data and technical skills in a fast-growing company where you can have an impact. The British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI) is currently seeking co-op students/interns to support projects & initiatives being implemented as part of our Data & Analytics strategy for the Summer 2026 work term (May to August or December). WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW BCI manages a globally diversified portfolio of assets valued at $295 billion and is one of Canada's largest institutional investors. We invest globally to support pension and other funds for more than 30 institutional clients based in British Columbia. We are proud to have been chosen as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and BC's Top Employers. These national and provincial competitions recognize employers who offer exceptional workplaces for their employees. WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH The Data & Analytics branch, part of the Corporate Data & Operations department, is the strategic data and intelligence engine that transforms raw data into actionable insights, powering value driven decisions and increasing efficiencies for BCI. Using industry leading and modern data tools like Snowflake, Databricks, and Power BI, the Data & Analytics branch empowers the organization to deliver strategic clarity by cutting through the noise to reveal metrics, operational excellence by building use case driven real time interactive dashboards, and leading BCI towards a data-driven culture by making data easy, governed, and accessible. WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING • Supporting the implementation of Data & Analytics projects and initiatives • Creating reports and dashboards using Power BI and SQL • Creating re-usable curated datasets using SQL or Python Work with Data & Analytics team to drive data literacy across BCI • WHAT WE OFFER • Excellent career development and training by contributing to a strategic program with high visibility • Work with a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment • The development of real-world skills at one of the largest institutional investors in Canada • Exposure to some of the most talented, approachable, and inspiring people in the industry • The ability to opt-in for access to Dialogue, a user-friendly app that offers virtual primary care, employee and family services, and mental health supports • Time to connect with co-op students & interns at BCI - build your network and shared learning • • Two paid days per year for volunteering Competitive pay: $2,155.00 gross bi-weekly + vacation leave paid based on 6% of salary ($2,330.00 gross biweekly for those with (or working towards) a graduate degree and $2,155.00 gross biweekly for those with (or working towards) an undergraduate degree, diploma, or certificate) • Travel: if coming to Victoria or Vancouver for this work term, BCI will provide a fixed-rate travel allowance based on your location THE DETAILS • Work term: Summer and/or Fall 2026 (May to August and/or December) • Department: Corporate Data & Operations • Office Location: 750 Pandora Avenue, Victoria, BC or 666 Burrard Street, Vancouver BC • Spend your off hours exploring beautiful Victoria and Vancouver Island or experiencing the beauty of lower mainland • All co-ops/internships will need to be completed in person at our Victoria or Vancouver office with the option to work one day per week from home. Please note, some positions are not eligible for hybrid work. Job Requirements THE IDEAL STUDENT • Has a keen interest in data & technology and is a self-starter • Has working knowledge of major AI tools like Perplexity, Claude or Copilot • Demonstrates they are a team player, but can also work independently • Demonstrates an extremely strong work ethic and displays initiative to strive to deliver value above and beyond the job description • Comes up with creative ideas to improve the business reporting process REQUIRED SKILLS • Exhibit a high level of professionalism and excellent interpersonal skills • Ability to meet deadlines while maintaining accuracy, excellent product quality, and attention to detail • Has an interest in data, a dedication to hard work, commitment to the highest ethical standards, and an eagerness to learn • Ability to use Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Outlook • Familiarity using Microsoft 365 tools such as One Drive, SharePoint Online, and MS Teams would be an asset • Familiarity with reporting tools such as Power BI • Ability to read and write basic code scripts in SQL • Ability to implement and debug basic Python scripts Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Special Application Instructions APPLICATION LINK: https://bci.wd10.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/BCI_Careers/details/Data---Analytics-Engineer-Co-op- Internship--Summer-and-or-Fall-2026-_JR101359 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
